definition[0]: if you invoke a law, rule etc, you say that you are doing something because the law allows or forces you to
example[0]: The UN threatened to invoke economic sanctions if the talks were broken off.
definition[1]: to make a particular idea, image, or feeling appear in peopleâ€™s minds by describing an event or situation, or by talking about a person
example[1]: a painting that invokes images of the Rocky Mountains
example[2]: During his speech, he invoked the memory of Harry Truman.
definition[2]: to use a law, principle, or theory to support your views
definition[4]: to ask for help from someone more powerful than you, especially a god
example[3]: St. Genevieve is often invoked against plagues.
definition[5]: to make spirits appear by using magic
example[4]: invoking the spirits of their ancestors
definition[6]: to use a law, principle etc to support a view or decision
example[5]: The seller of the goods invoked an exclusion clause in the guarantee.
